1: <sup>1</sup> Brethren, if a man be overtaken in a fault, ye which are spiritual, restore such an one in the spirit of meekness; considering thyself, lest thou also be tempted.
2: <sup>2</sup> Bear ye one another’s burdens, and so fulfil the law of Christ.
3: <sup>3</sup> For if a man think himself to be something, when he is nothing, he deceiveth himself.
4: <sup>4</sup> But let every man prove his own work, and then shall he have rejoicing in himself alone, and not in another.
5: <sup>5</sup> For every man shall bear his own burden.
6: <sup>6</sup> Let him that is taught in the word communicate unto him that teacheth in all good things.
7: <sup>7</sup> Be not deceived; God is not mocked: for whatsoever a man soweth, that shall he also reap.
8: <sup>8</sup> For he that soweth to his flesh shall of the flesh reap corruption; but he that soweth to the Spirit shall of the Spirit reap life everlasting.
9: <sup>9</sup> And let us not be weary in well doing: for in due season we shall reap, if we faint not.
10: <sup>10</sup> As we have therefore opportunity, let us do good unto all men, especially unto them who are of the household of faith.
11: <sup>11</sup> Ye see how large a letter I have written unto you with mine own hand.
12: <sup>12</sup> As many as desire to make a fair shew in the flesh, they constrain you to be circumcised; only lest they should suffer persecution for the cross of Christ.
13: <sup>13</sup> For neither they themselves who are circumcised keep the law; but desire to have you circumcised, that they may glory in your flesh.
14: <sup>14</sup> But God forbid that I should glory, save in the cross of our Lord Jesus Christ, by whom the world is crucified unto me, and I unto the world.
15: <sup>15</sup> For in Christ Jesus neither circumcision availeth any thing, nor uncircumcision, but a new creature.
16: <sup>16</sup> And as many as walk according to this rule, peace be on them, and mercy, and upon the Israel of God.
17: <sup>17</sup> From henceforth let no man trouble me: for I bear in my body the marks of the Lord Jesus.
18: <sup>18</sup> Brethren, the grace of our Lord Jesus Christ be with your spirit. Amen.
